story:
Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the big garden. Her mom always watched her from the window. The garden was full of flowers and butterflies.

One day, Lily saw a slow, cute turtle in the garden. She wanted to play with the turtle, but it moved very, very slow. She gently picked it up and put it on the soft grass. “Mom, look!” she said. “A turtle!”

Lily’s mom smiled and said, “Be gentle, it moves slow.” That afternoon, it started to rain. Lily’s mom called her inside. “Let’s go inside, Lily,” she said. As they went in, Lily hugged the turtle and said, “See you soon!” The next day, the garden was a little wet, but the turtle was still there, ready to play again.

story:
Once there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to swim. One day, he asked, "Mom, can we go to the pool?" 

Mom smiled and said, "Yes, Tim. Let’s go!" They put on their swim suits and went to the big pool. The water was cool and soft. 

Tim splashed and laughed. Mom said, "Swim to me, Tim." Tim swam to Mom and hugged her. Mom's arms were soft and warm. The end.

story:
Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Jack. Jack loved to draw. He had many colors and liked to draw everything he saw. One day, Jack saw a big, red cup on the table. He wanted to draw the cup, so he got his paper and crayons out.

While Jack was drawing, his baby sister, Lily, came into the room. She was very loud and kept calling out for Jack. "Jack! Jack!" she said. Jack felt upset because the loud noise made it hard to think. He asked Lily to be quiet, but she did not listen.

Then, Mom came and saw what was happening. She told Lily, "Sweetie, Jack is drawing. We need to be quiet so he can draw nicely." Lily nodded and whispered, "Sorry, Jack." Jack smiled and finished his drawing of the red cup. He felt happy and gave the picture to Lily. The family learned that quiet moments can help make good things happen.
